interpGrp.interp: Changes in spelling or orthography. This includes any alterations to how words are written without affecting their meaning, such as standardizing spelling or correcting errors. Also includes adding or removing an alif as a marker of the accusative or at the end of a plural verb. Changes to the diacritics for a final ي or ى can be ignored. If the change affects the meaning or grammatical function of the word (such as the form of a verb), then it is more significant than an orthographic change and should not be in this category.

An addition, omission or substitution to a single minor word or part of a word. A minor word means a conjunction, pronoun, demonstrative pronoun (e.g. ذلك), pronominal suffix, definite article, preposition, interrogative particle (such as 'ما') or other particle (such as 'قد'). This includes the expansion or contraction of a word and changes to verb form, such as modifications in verb tense, form, or voice, including changes to person or number and transformations between participle and verb. If the root word is the same but the number changes, then it falls in this category. It can still be in this category if the change affects the meaning substantially, so long as it is only affecting the part of speech described here or it does not change the root of the word. If there are changes to multiple words between readings (even if they are minor), then it should not be in this category but it is under 'Multiple_Word_Changes'. If there are multiple minor changes to a single word, then it can still be a Single_Minor_Word_Change.

An addition, omission or substitution to a single word that is more significant than a conjunction, pronoun, pronominal suffix, definite article, preposition, or particle (such as 'قد'). It is only a major word change if the root of the word is different. If a word is changed to a different form of the same root, then it is a Single_Minor_Word_Change. If the two readings are identical except for a difference in a single major word, then it is in this category (even if the readings otherwise contain multiple words).

Changes across more than one word. Words can be major or minor. Even if the changes are minor, if multiple words are changed, then it falls in this category. If more than one word is added or omitted, then it is in this category.

app.rdg: قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود
قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود
قال الرب لليهود الذين اتوا اليه

relation.desc: Several words are added.
More than one word is changed because by transposing اليهود it also affects the ل preposition.

Multiple words are added to the text, including the major words قال الرب, للذين, اتوا, اليه, and من اليهود. This falls under the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes, which includes any changes across more than one word, whether those words are major or minor.
c.f. OMIT ➞ قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود

[Multiple words are added to the text, including the phrase "قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود", which involves more than one word and changes the entire context of the passage. This falls under the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes, which specifies that if multiple words are added or changed, the category is Multiple_Word_Changes.]
c.f. OMIT ➞ قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود

[The change involves the omission of the final alif in اتوا, which is a spelling variation that does not affect the meaning or grammatical function of the word. This is consistent with the definition of orthographic changes, specifically the example of "قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود → قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود" provided in the original instructions.]
c.f. قال الرب للذين اتوا اليه من اليهود ➞ قال الرب للذين اتو اليه من اليهود
Several words are added.

[The entire phrase containing major words (يسوع and ايضا) is omitted. Since this involves a complete removal of a phrase with substantive words, it falls under Single_Major_Word_Change, not Multiple_Word_Changes, because only one segment of text is being affected.]
c.f. فكلمهم ايضا يسوع ➞ OMIT
A single major word is added.
Two words are added.

[Two words are added (صوته and وقال), which changes more than one word in the text. This matches the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes, which states that if more than one word is added or changed, it falls into this category. This is similar to the example "OMIT → صوته وقال" in the provided examples.]
c.f. وقال ➞ صوته وقال
The pronoun هو is added which is a minor word.

[The change is a minor orthographic variation involving the preposition في, where the spelling is changed from في to فى, which does not affect the meaning or grammatical function of the word. This is similar to the examples of orthographic changes like adding or removing an alif, and does not substantively alter the text's meaning.]
c.f. يمشي في الظلمه الي ➞ يمشي فى الظلمه
The preposition (with pronominal suffix) معه is changed to له.
The preposition ل is added to الدهر.

[The change involves two minor word modifications: first, the major noun الابد is replaced with the major noun الدهر (which would typically be a Single_Major_Word_Change), but the preposition (with pronominal suffix) معه is changed to له, which falls under the Single_Minor_Word_Change category. This is similar to the example provided: "الدهر بل تكون له → الدهر بل تكون معه" which demonstrates a change in prepositions with pronominal suffixes.]
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ الدهر بل تكون له

[Multiple words are changed: the noun الابد is changed to الدهر (a major word change), the verb تكون is changed to يكون (a minor word change), and the preposition معه is changed to له (a minor word change). Since more than one word is altered, this falls under the Multiple_Word_Changes category, similar to the example "فعال ابيكم ابليس → فعال ابوكم الشيطان" where multiple words are modified.]
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ الدهر بل يكون له

[The major word الابد is changed to الدهر, which involves a change in the root word. This is similar to the example "بيت الكنز → بيت القربان" where a major noun is substituted for another. The rest of the text remains identical, so this falls under Single_Major_Word_Change.]
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ الدهر بل تكون معه

[The changes involve minor words: the preposition للدهر replaces الابد, and the pronominal suffix له replaces معه. These are both minor word changes according to the definition, as they involve prepositions and pronominal suffixes. This is similar to the example "الدهر بل تكون له → الدهر بل تكون معه" in the Single_Minor_Word_Change category, but in the reverse direction.]
c.f. الابد بل تكون معه ➞ للدهر بل تكون له

[The verb form is changed from تكون to يكون, which involves a modification of verb form while maintaining the same root. This matches the definition of Single_Minor_Word_Change, which includes "changes to verb form, such as modifications in verb tense, form, or voice". The example provided earlier of "تكونوا احرار → تكونون احرار" is analogous to this case.]
c.f. الدهر بل تكون له ➞ الدهر بل يكون له

[The change involves a modification of the verb form from يكون to تكون (changing person/number) and a substitution of the pronominal suffix from له to معه, which are both considered minor word changes according to the definition. This is similar to the example "الدهر بل تكون له → الدهر بل تكون معه" in the provided examples.]
c.f. الدهر بل يكون له ➞ الدهر بل تكون معه

[The change involves adding the preposition ل to the beginning of الدهر, which is a minor word change. The verb form also changes from يكون to تكون, which falls within the definition of Single_Minor_Word_Change as a modification of verb form. This matches the example provided earlier of changing verb forms or adding/modifying prepositions, such as "اجاب يسوع فقال → اجاب يسوع فقال لهم" where a preposition is added.]
c.f. الدهر بل يكون له ➞ للدهر بل تكون له

[The change involves a minor word (preposition) modification from معه to له, and the addition of the definite article ل at the start of الدهر. This matches the definition of Single_Minor_Word_Change, which includes changes to prepositions and pronominal suffixes. This is similar to the example "الدهر بل تكون له → الدهر بل تكون معه" in the original examples, which was categorized as a Single_Minor_Word_Change.]
c.f. الدهر بل تكون معه ➞ للدهر بل تكون له

[The major word نور is added to the existing phrase, which changes the meaning substantially. This is a significant addition of a word with a different root, not just a minor particle or conjunction. The core word الحياه remains the same, but the addition of نور represents a major word change that alters the semantic content of the phrase.]
c.f. الحياه ➞ نور الحياه

[The word الي is a preposition, which falls under the category of minor words as defined in the Single_Minor_Word_Change description. Adding a preposition is a minor change that does not affect the root of any word or substantially change the meaning of the text.]
c.f. OMIT ➞ الي
The pronoun انت is added and an alif is added to تشهد.
A ب preposition is add to حق.
The orthographic change is made to يسوع making it ايسوع and the ف conjunction is changed to a و.
The conjunction ف is changed to و.
The spelling of يسوع is changed to ايسوع.
The verb اجاب is added and the phrase فقال لهم is moved to the end. The conjunction ف is changed to a و.

[The change involves multiple modifications: the addition of the conjunction ف at the start, the transposition of لهم before ايسوع, and the change in spelling of يسوع to ايسوع. Even though some of these changes are minor, the fact that multiple words are affected places this in the Multiple_Word_Changes category.]
c.f. اجاب يسوع فقال لهم ➞ فقال لهم ايسوع

[The change is simply a spelling variant of يسوع, where the initial alif is added or removed. This does not affect the meaning or grammatical function of the word, and is purely an orthographic change in spelling.]
c.f. اجاب ايسوع وقال لهم ➞ اجاب يسوع وقال لهم

[The change is from the conjunction و to the conjunction ف, which is a minor word change. This matches the example of "فقالوا → وقالوا" in the Single_Minor_Word_Change category, but in this case reversed. The change involves only a single minor word (the conjunction) and does not affect the meaning or root of the words.]
c.f. اجاب ايسوع وقال لهم ➞ اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم

[The change involves adding the verb اجاب at the beginning and transposing the prepositional phrase لهم to the end, which affects multiple words and their order. This matches the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes, which includes changes across more than one word, even if the individual changes might be minor.]
c.f. فقال لهم ايسوع ➞ اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم

[The change is simply a spelling variant of يسوع by adding an initial alif (ايسوع), which does not affect the meaning or grammatical function of the word. This is consistent with the orthography category examples provided, such as the example of changing اجاب يسوع فقال لهم → اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم, which specifically demonstrates an orthographic change in the spelling of يسوع.]
c.f. اجاب يسوع وقال لهم ➞ اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم
The conjunction و is added.
The preposition هي is added.

من اين انا والي اين اذهب واما انتم
اين اتيت ولا الى اين انطلق
اين اتيت ولا الي اين اذهب

relation.desc: Multiple words are changed.

[The change involves removing the conjunction وانتم and the particle انما, which are both minor words. The root word انتم remains unchanged, and the modification involves only minor words (conjunction and particle), which matches the definition of Single_Minor_Word_Change as described in the provided examples, such as the example "وان → ان" where a conjunction is removed.]
c.f. وانتم انما ➞ انتم
The major word تقظون is omitted.

[The entire phrase ايما تقضون is a major word (not a minor particle or conjunction) and is being completely omitted. This matches the definition of Single_Major_Word_Change where a single significant word or phrase is removed, similar to the example "كثير → OMIT" in the provided sample cases.]
c.f. ايما تقضون ➞ OMIT
The pronoun انتم is added.

[The change is to the verb form, specifically modifying the verb تقضون to تقضوا. This falls under the Single_Minor_Word_Change category because it involves a change in verb form (person or number) while maintaining the same root verb. The example "تكونوا احرار → تكونون احرار" in the previous examples demonstrates a similar type of verb form modification that is classified as a Single_Minor_Word_Change.]
c.f. OMIT ➞ تقضوا
The conjunction و is added.

[The change involves adding the conjunction و to the start of the phrase, which falls under the definition of a minor word change. This is similar to the example "اما الابن → واما الابن" where the conjunction و is added. The core words remain the same, and only a minor particle (conjunction) is modified.]
c.f. اما انا ➞ وانا

[The change involves removing the minor word اما, which is a conjunction/particle, while keeping the core word انا intact. This matches the definition of Single_Minor_Word_Change, which allows for addition, omission, or substitution of minor words like conjunctions. Similar to the example "وان → ان" where the conjunction و is added/removed, this variant involves a similar minor word change.]
c.f. واما انا ➞ وانا
An alif of nasb is added to احد.
Two changes occur. The conjunction ف is added at the start and the orthographic change occurs by addings an alif of nasb to احد.
Diacritics are added.
The conjunction ف is added at the start.

[The change involves adding the conjunction ف at the start of the phrase and adding the alif of nasb to احد, which are both minor word changes. The first change is a conjunction addition, and the second is an orthographic marker that does not fundamentally alter the meaning. This matches the example of "ليس ادين احدا → فليس ادين احدًا" in the Single_Minor_Word_Change category.]
c.f. ليس ادين احد ➞ فليس ادين احدا

[The change involves adding the conjunction ف at the start of the phrase, which falls under the definition of a minor word change. This is similar to the example "ليس ادين احدا → فليس ادين احدًا" in the provided examples, where a conjunction is added at the start of the phrase.]
c.f. ليس ادين احد ➞ فليس ادين احد

[The change involves adding the conjunction ف at the start of the phrase, which falls under the definition of a minor word change. This is similar to the example "ليس ادين احدا → فليس ادين احدًا" in the provided examples, where a conjunction is added at the start of the phrase.]
c.f. ليس ادين احدا ➞ فليس ادين احدا

[The change involves adding the conjunction ف at the start of the phrase and removing the alif of nasb from احدا, which are both minor word changes. The conjunction ف is a particle, and the alif of nasb modification is an orthographic change. Since these are single, minor changes, this falls under the Single_Minor_Word_Change category, similar to the example "ليس ادين احدا → فليس ادين احدًا" provided in the original examples.]
c.f. ليس ادين احدا ➞ فليس ادين احد

[The change involves the removal of the final alif of nasb (accusative marker) on احدا, which does not affect the meaning or grammatical function of the word. This is similar to the example of adding or removing an alif of nasb, such as احد → احدا or احدًا, which falls under orthographic changes.]
c.f. فليس ادين احدا ➞ فليس ادين احد

[The change is simply the removal of the diacritical mark (tanwin/nunation) on احد, which does not affect the meaning or grammatical function of the word. This is similar to the example provided in the original instructions: "فليس ادين احدا → فليس ادين احدًا [Diacritics are added.]" The change is purely orthographic and does not alter the substantive meaning of the text.]
c.f. فليس ادين احدًا ➞ فليس ادين احد

[The variation involves adding the word هو and changing the pronominal suffix لاني to لان, which affects multiple words and thus falls under the Multiple_Word_Changes category. Even though the changes are relatively minor (adding a pronoun and removing a pronominal suffix), the fact that more than one word is modified means this cannot be classified as a Single_Minor_Word_Change.]
c.f. لاني ➞ هو لان
Changes occur to two words.
The form of لست is changed to ليست.
The form of ليست is changed to ليس.

[The change is from one form of the verb to another form of the same root, which involves a modification of the verb's form. This is similar to the example "ليست واحدى → ليس وحدي" in the provided examples, where the verb form is changed while maintaining the same essential meaning.]
c.f. لست وحدي ➞ ليس وحدي

[The change is to the verb form from the feminine ليست to the masculine ليس, which falls under the category of modifications to verb form, person, or number. This is consistent with the definition of Single_Minor_Word_Change, which includes transformations in verb tense, form, or voice, and the change does not affect the root of the word.]
c.f. ليست وحدي ➞ ليس وحدي
The pronoun انا is added.
A pronominal suffix is added.
A و conjunction is omitted and pronominal suffix is added to a single word.

[The change is purely orthographic, involving the removal of the initial conjunction و without affecting the meaning or grammatical function of the word. This is similar to other orthographic examples like removing or adding a conjunction or altering spelling without changing the word's core meaning.]
c.f. ولكني ➞ لكنى
Multiple words are added.
Multiple words are omitted.
Two words are added.

[The word حق is a major word (noun) that is completely omitted, which matches the definition of a Single_Major_Word_Change where a single significant word is removed. This is similar to the example "كثير → OMIT" in the provided sample cases, where a major word is omitted.]
c.f. حق ➞ OMIT

[The change involves adding a minor word (هي), which is a pronoun. This falls under the definition of Single_Minor_Word_Change as it involves the addition of a single minor word (a pronoun) without changing the root meaning of the text.]
c.f. حق ➞ حق هي
The pronoun انا is omitted.

c.f. انا ➞ وانا
The major word اشهد is omitted.
The preposition علي is omitted.

[The word نفسى is a major word (a noun) and it is being completely omitted. This matches the definition of Single_Major_Word_Change where a single major word is added, omitted, or substituted. Similar to the example "كثير → OMIT" where a major word is omitted, this variation involves removing a significant word from the text.]
c.f. نفسى ➞ OMIT

[The change involves substituting a single minor word (the preposition على with the preposition لي), which falls under the definition of Single_Minor_Word_Change. The root words remain the same, and only the preposition is altered, which matches the category's description of changes to prepositions.]
c.f. على ذلك ➞ لي ذلك

[The entire phrase is changed to a different phrase with multiple words. Both the preposition and the demonstrative pronoun are replaced, which falls under the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes, which occurs when changes happen across more than one word, even if the individual changes might be minor.]
c.f. على ذلك ➞ لي وهو

[The change involves substituting a minor word (ذلك) with another minor word (وهو). This falls under the category of Single_Minor_Word_Change because it involves a single word substitution, and the substituted word is a demonstrative pronoun, which is explicitly listed as a minor word in the definition. The root meaning remains substantially the same, and only a minor word is being changed.]
c.f. لي ذلك ➞ لي وهو

The addition of the alif at the beginning is an orthographic variant that does not change the pronunciation or meaning of the name يسوع. This is similar to the example provided earlier of اجاب ايسوع فقال لهم → اجاب يسوع فقال لهم, which was categorized as an orthographic change.]
c.f. يسوع ➞ ايسوع
Two words are omitted.
Two words are omitted.

c.f. فقال لهم ➞ وقال لهم
The preposition ب is added to هذا.

This falls under the category of changes to verb tense or form, which is explicitly described as a Single_Minor_Word_Change. The root of the verb remains the same (كلم), and only the verb's temporal aspect is altered.]
c.f. كان يكلمهم ➞ كلمهم

The root word remains the same (ساعة), and only a minor grammatical element (the definite article) has been altered. This falls under the definition of Single_Minor_Word_Change, which includes changes to articles and does not fundamentally change the meaning of the word.]
c.f. لان ساعته لم ➞ لان الساعه لم

[Two words are changed: the conjunction لان is replaced by اذ كانت, which involves changing both the conjunction and the verb form. This matches the definition that if multiple words are changed, even if the changes are minor, it falls under the Multiple_Word_Changes category. This is similar to the example in the provided list: "لان ساعته لم → اذ كانت لم [Two words are changed.]"]
c.f. لان ساعه لم ➞ اذ كانت لم

The word بلغت is changed to اتت.
The verb اتت is changed to اقتربت.
c.f. تكون اقتربت ➞ تكن اتت

[The root of the verb changes from بلغ (to reach/arrive) to قرب (to approach/come near), which represents a significant change in meaning. This is similar to the example "تكون اتت → تكون اقتربت" in the provided examples, where a verb with a different root is substituted. The change affects a single major word and involves a transformation between two verbs with distinct roots.]
c.f. تكن بلغت ➞ تكون اقتربت

[This is a minor orthographic change involving the removal of the final vowel و in تكون, which does not affect the meaning or grammatical function of the word. The verb remains in the same form and the root is unchanged. This is similar to other orthographic examples like changes in spelling or diacritical marks that do not substantively alter the text.]
c.f. تكون اتت ➞ تكن اتت

[The root of the verb changes from اقتربت (to approach/draw near) to اتت (to come), which represents a significant change in meaning beyond a minor modification. This matches the example in the provided guidelines where "تكون اتت → تكون اقتربت" was categorized as a Single_Major_Word_Change due to the change in the root verb.]

relation.desc: Multiple wrds are added.
The final alif in اتوا is omitted.
Multiple wrds are added.
Two words are omitted.

[Multiple words are changed: the verb اذهب is changed to انطلق (a major word change), the verb form تطلبوني is changed to تطلبونى (a minor word change), and the preposition وفي is changed to ولا (a minor word change). Since more than one word is modified, this falls under the Multiple_Word_Changes category.]
c.f. اذهب وتطلبوني وفي ➞ انطلق وتطلبونى ولا

[The change involves the removal of the conjunction و, which is a minor word (particle). This matches the definition of Single_Minor_Word_Change, which includes addition, omission, or substitution of a single minor word like a conjunction. This is similar to the example "وان → ان" where the conjunction و is removed.]
c.f. وبخطاياكم ➞ خطاياكم

[This variation involves changing multiple words: the verb تموتون is replaced by تجدونى, and خطاياكم is replaced by باثمكم. Even though the changes are to individual words, the fact that more than one word is altered means this falls under the Multiple_Word_Changes category, as specified in the guidelines. The changes involve both a verb modification and a substantive noun change, which further supports categorizing this as Multiple_Word_Changes.]
c.f. خطاياكم ➞ تجدونى وباثمكم

[The change is to the verb form, specifically the verb ending from تموتون (second person plural masculine present/future) to تموتوا (second person plural masculine subjunctive/jussive). This falls under the category of modifications in verb form, which is explicitly described as a Single_Minor_Word_Change, as the root of the word remains the same and only the grammatical form is altered.]
c.f. تموتون وحيث ➞ تموتوا وحيث
The pronoun (with conjunction) فانتم is added.

[The root of the verb changes from ن-ط-ل-ق (to set out/depart) to ذ-ه-ب (to go), which represents a change in the major word with a different root, not just a modification of verb form or minor word.]
c.f. انطلق انا ➞ اذهب انا

[Multiple words are changed: the verb اذهب is replaced with انطلق, and an additional word فانتم is added. This meets the definition of Multiple_Word_Changes, which includes changes across more than one word, even if the changes are minor. The example is similar to other Multiple_Word_Changes examples like "انا اياه → فهو" or "اجاب يسوع فقال → اجاب يسوع وقال لهم" where multiple words are altered.]
c.f. اذهب انا ➞ انطلق انا فانتم
The form of تاتون is changed to تاتوا.
